content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Copper Cable Factory at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Wooden chest (cable factory input) at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
– Burner inserter (fuelled with coal) at Position(x=1.5, y=17.5)
– Burner inserter (new factory component) at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5)
– Burner inserter (additional interface) at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5)
– Assembling machine (for copper cable production) at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5)
– Wooden chest (secondary storage) at Position(x=1.5, y=21.5)

### Belt Depot Structure at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Wooden chest (depot) at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
– Transport belt segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5)
– Depot burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5)

### Extraction System at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5)
Consists of the following entity:
– Burner inserter (serving as extraction system output) at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5) with drop position Position(x=-3.5, y=28.5)

### Electricity Generator at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Steam engine (generator) at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)
– Boiler at Position(x=-5.5, y=24.0)
– Offshore pump at Position(x=-7.5, y=25.5)

### Iron Smelter at Position(x=-3.0, y=19.0)
Consists of the following entities:
– Stone furnace (producing iron plates) at Position(x=-3.0, y=19.0)
– Wooden chest (storage/output) at Position(x=-4.5, y=18.5)

### Copper Smelter at Position(x=-4.0, y=21.0)
Consists of the following entities:
– Stone furnace (producing copper plates) at Position(x=-4.0, y=21.0)
– Wooden chest (storage/output) at Position(x=-5.5, y=21.5)

ERROR TIPS

– Belt Connection Target Error (Recurring in Steps 210, 211, 213, 214, 215, 216, 217)
 • Transport belts are being connected to a Prototype.SteamEngine object. To avoid this error, always add an inserter that feeds into the steam engine and use that inserter as the belt’s target.

– Placement Range Error (Step 212)
 • The error “Could not place wooden-chest … target position is too far” indicates that the target is out of range. Move closer to the target position (ensure distance is within the allowed maximum) before attempting placement.

– Inventory Availability Error (Step 213)
 • The error “No wooden_chest in inventory” shows that the required item is missing. Verify that the inventory contains the necessary item before issuing a placement command.

– Variable Name Error (Step 212)
 • The NameError regarding “target_chest” suggests an undefined variable was referenced. Use correctly defined variable names and check for typographical errors to avoid such mistakes.
